ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Attending class every day and having to speak regularly in Spanish helped improve my speaking fluency, as well as listening skills. The course also solidified Spanish grammar concepts.
I learned how to speak a lot better!
Ability to use Spanish in everyday conversations, more confidence with Spanish reading and writing.
I learned how to speak conversationally in Spanish
Basic spanish vocabulary and grammar which are applicable in daily life

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Meeting five days a week is a definite strength of this course, as this, combined with the requirement that we speak Spanish in class, helped facilitate rapid learning of the language. Some of the homework seemed like busy work, but overall I thought the homework was also helpful in reinforcing concepts learned in class.
A definite strength is the rigor of the course - really forces you to learn and retain. A weakness is that the pace of class means you learn quickly but also forget quickly.

The instructor did not always adhere to the syllabus completely, which made me slightly confused regarding the allocated homework which we had to complete. I felt that the readings in the coursebook could have been provided with more definitions included in the glossary because the text included much unfamiliar vocabulary which we had to look up otherwise. The textbook was very expensive and we could have been provided with cheaper options where the entire book could be used instead of just Chapter 10 onwards.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student because it is a good way to learn a foreign language without unnecessary difficulty or stress.
Great for learning Spanish without overwhelming busywork
It is useful for daily practice in the language to improve fluency and vocabulary
